reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for a night as part of a wedding party. The hotel and grounds were lovely; the food was great; the rooms modern and good value for money.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and Good Value for Money

reviews.text: The service was a little haphazard, but nothing serious.
reviews.title: PERFECT DAY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My son and daughter-in-law have just had their wedding reception at Stanneylands and I can honestly say I could not fault this hotel or the staff. Everything about the day was absolutely perfect. Eamonn who organised everything for the day was wonderful, the wedding breakfast was superb - the meal was fabulous and the waiting on staff were brilliant; the bedroom elegant, the wedding reception room beautiful (I was glad of the air conditioning as it turned out to be a very warm day!).On Sunday morning the breakfast was delicious, ok a little pricey, but well worth it! My son and daughter-in-law used the hotel's flower arranger, dj and MC and again, all were simply superb. I hope I haven't forgotten anyone! What a wonderful day, thank you very very much.
reviews.title: Unpretentious. Peaceful. Relaxed. Quietly efficient.

likes.liked: — The location, quality and comfort of the room, fabulous bed, friendly staff, excellent food.
likes.disliked: — Small public seating area around the reception desk.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Stanneylands on a Friday night, paying £60 for room only and im afraid i feel totally ripped off! Ill start with the good bits....... I had booked the restaurant and it seemed they did a deal of £24.50 for 3 courses, wine and coffee, this was all very nice and value for money considering the average price of a main course was £20+!!! Crazy or what?! Starters averaged out about £9.... Now for the bad bits.......We were put in room 101 - this is THE worst room in the hotel (I hope), situated on the ground floor right next to the toilets, you can hear the toilet doors banging and the flush. The hotel was practically empty so i dont know why we were put there. Anyway, one of the curtains was hanging off , and the bed had two great craters in it (mustve been one of those "memory mattresses"!!!) Not being one to cause a fuss, I let this go only because I didnt want to ruin the night.
reviews.title: Terrible Room :-(

reviews.text: I was soooo looking forward to a nice lay in being the start of the bank holiday weekend :-) but we were woken out of our "craters" at 7am by the catering company unloading boxes outside the window, this was proceeded by the bottle bank being emptied at 7.45. Naturally - or not - we were awake by now - good job because at 8.15 the housekeeper wanted to clean the room!! Oh and there was no remote control.
reviews.title: Rip-off breakfast deal

likes.disliked: — Overpriced breakfast and only average wedding reception food.

reviews.title: Peaceful
reviews.text: I explained all of this to the receptionist who wasnt interested at the time. The manager has since called me back to say he hopes it wouldnt put us off staying again.. hermmmm. Im afraid it has. Please please please stay somewhere else!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided to have breakfast during a weekend stay for a family wedding. It was not included in the price of the room. Biggest rip-off ever. £14.95 for cooked breakfast and £10.95 for Continental. Buffet for continental was sparse, empty fruit salad bowls and empty fruit platter, no fresh bread or rolls, a plate of meat but nothing for vegetarians - no eggs, cheese, fruit yoghurt s etc..
reviews.title: Over rated!!
The early bird catches the worm
reviews.text: People were waiting for breakfast items in the cooked breakfast buffet having to visit 2 or 3 times to get the items they wanted eg. mushrooms. Staff were miserable and a little officious, I just don't think they were coping. Very, very disappointing and a very poor deal for the over-inflated price the hotel charged.
